page.title: 11AMENITIES,DUNTISBNOURNE AREA
page.content: We found few amenities.One important part of Community life, the village school, has disappeared from both villages.Children go to Birdlip or Daglingworth Primary and Cirencester on a school bus for Secondary.In Winstone there is a public service bus to Cirencester 2 days a week, in Duntisbourne only once.Most people said a car was a necessity.In fact about 85% had their own car.Many villagers are completely cut off in winter until the snow plough comes through and they have to rely on food from the freezer.There are no village shops.The only Post Office is in a Council house in Winstone.Both villages have a Telephone Kiosk.There is no surgery; a doctor calls every Tuesday at the Village Hall.There is mains water(1936),electricity(1951),no gas supply or mains drainage.
